keyword: how many calories in chicken breast fried
title: How Many Calories in Fried Chicken Breast?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in chicken breast fried per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition breakdowns with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in Fried Chicken Breast?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, breaded and deep-fried in vegetable oil; standard portion without sauce.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by breading type, oil used, frying time, and portion size. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of fried chicken breast contains about 260 kcal and 25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 260 kcal per 100 g breaded and deep-fried.

faqs.q: Is fried chicken breast high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 15 g total fat per 100 g due to breading and oil absorption.

faqs.q: How does frying affect chicken breast calories?
faqs.a: Frying adds calories from oil and breading, raising it from ~165 kcal (grilled) to ~260 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: What's the protein in fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Around 25 g protein per 100 g, similar to grilled but with added carbs from breading.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for air-frying or skip breading to cut ~60-80 kcal per 100 g.
